I have no idea who might want to buy Nvidia, but many companies come to mind when synergies are taken into consideration. But I do know that if someone wanted to they could pick the company up for a song! An offer at $18 would cost an acquiring company only $7B. (18*600M shares minus 3.73B in cash). This cost is further reduced by $600M in Intel Royalties yet to come. $6.4B is chump change for the Apple, Google, Microsoft's of the world. I remember when TI bought National Semi...and everyone was shocked by it! The sudden turn around by Nvidia's management by issuing a dividend and starting to buyback shares might be because they realized how unbelievably cheap their company could be bought for or someone out a feeler. Who knows?

Topic.Title: Chitown - When will Apple use Tegra as you fantasize & claim...

Message.Msg: T4, like other standalone processors, hasn't a prayer in the world of getting into aapl. aapl can strin together their own or design their own much better than nvda can. T3i however, stands a chance iff i500 can do 3G. That would allow aapl or even samsung a single quick to market world wide solution for a cheaper iPhone/Galaxy S. And that is a big if, seeing how i400 ANG for 3Gs. I ,would look to samsung adopting an outside solution much quicker than aapl doing it, Samsung, in using brche m's totally integrated solutions, has proven they are not just tied to their own processors. heck, samsung might even fab the T3i for nvda. Die is cast for the bleeding edge, T4 wouldn't play regardless of benchmark or no benchmark. The fight is for the huge non bleeding edge market where there is a chance to differentiate in the chips by integrating more onto the processor. By fight, I mean fight for something that counts, like sales $s. Jen can have his bragging rights. BTW, Samsung is supposedly ramping dual core A9 single chip solutions from brcm later on in the year. They are ramping single core single chip brcm solutions now. BTW, I reiterate, regardless of benchmarks, Vizio backing out of T4 tablet to me means T4 is not ready for prime time for whatever reason. If you are expecting T4 to ramp back Tegra sales for nvda, better relook at that model, for those who do model Tegra sales.

Topic.Title: Surface Win RT $499 model Sold Out Again Online At Best Buy

Message.Msg: anandtechDOTcom/show/6787/nvidia-tegra-4-architecture-deep-dive-plus-tegra-4i-phoenix-hands-on ARM’s Cortex A15 and Power Consumption Tegra 4’s CPU complex sees a significant improvement over Tegra 3. Despite being an ARM architecture licensee, NVIDIA once again licensed a complete processor from ARM rather than designing its own core. I do fundamentally believe that NVIDIA will go the full custom route eventually (see: Project Denver), but that’s a goal that will take time to come to fruition. In the case of Tegra 4, NVIDIA chose to license ARM’s Cortex A15 - the only vanilla ARM core presently offered that can deliver higher performance than a Cortex A9. Samsung recently disclosed details about its Cortex A15 implementation compared to the Cortex A7, a similarly performing but more power efficient alternative to the A9. In its ISSCC paper on the topic Samsung noted that the Cortex A15 offered up to 3x the performance of the Cortex A7, at 4x the area and 6x the power consumption. It’s a tremendous performance advantage for sure, but it comes at a great cost to area and power consumption. The area side isn’t as important as NVIDIA has to eat that cost, but power consumption is a valid concern. (((((Cortex A15 offered up to 3x the performance of the Cortex A7, at 4x the area and 6x the power consumption)))))

Message.Title: Microsoft Surface RT Tablet Adds 6 More Countries to Sales Distribution In Late March
Message.Msg: "The Surface RT, which uses the Windows RT operating system, will go on sale in late March in Japan, Mexico, New Zealand, Russia, Singapore and Taiwan, Microsoft announced in a Feb. 28 statement on its website, without specifying its pricing." That will bring the total No. of countries up to 27. Sure sounds like Microsoft is sticking with Win RT. Note: In the 4th quarter it was available only in the US and Canada.
great work
thanks

I think the T4i is a better all round mobile design at 28nm than T4 and not just for the integrated modem. A15 will really need 14-16-20nm to shine in terms of marrying design more optimally to silicon process which means clockspeed over 2 Ghz and getting individual core power down to about 1.5W max in a production device. Highly clocked A9 and 28nm are more optimally suited for a mobile device which is why I have recommended 28nm and 20nm shrinks of Tegra 3 for that reason beforehand, Nvidia went one better and beefed up the gpu too ;-).
thanks for sharing!

"A15 will really need 14-16-20nm to shine in terms of marrying design more optimally to silicon process " As you know, I think ARMH is a rubber stamp... The winners will design their own cores... I would think NVIdia, at a minimum, redesigned the glue around the CPUs... and hopefully did some enhancements & tweaking to the A15 cores... We're all waiting for independent benchmarks... "A9 and 28nm are more optimally suited for a mobile device which is why I have recommended 28nm and 20nm shrinks of Tegra 3" Appears NVIdia agrees with you...

"when nvda's tegra sales ramp" Project Denver... NVidia needs their own CPU cores... "I can bet you $ to donut it will be from T3i" It opens new markets that NVIdia could not compete in before... YOu can't win the game if you don't show up...
good report
